author: Weilun Soon, Yongchang Chin
description: US sanctions that come into effect on Friday could leave nearly 48 million barrels of Russian crude stranded on the water, pushing dozens of tankers to scramble for alternative destinations in the latest overhaul of the global oil trade.
title: Russian Oil at Risk of Being Stranded at Sea as US Sanctions Hit

author: Daniel Flatley
description: The Congressional Budget Office slashed its estimate of longer-term US fiscal savings from President Donald Trump’s tariff hikes by $1 trillion, in a move that may deepen concerns about American borrowing needs.
title: CBO Slashes US Budget Tariff-Savings Estimate by $1 Trillion

author: Katherine Chiglinsky
description: US banks are putting a plan for a $20 billion bailout for Argentina on the back burner and pivoting to a smaller $5 billion short-term financing facility, the Wall Street Journal reported.
title: US Banks Shift From $20 Billion Argentina Rescue, WSJ Says

author: Josh Wingrove, Augusta Saraiva
description: President Donald Trump is expanding tariff breaks for Brazilian food products, widening the scope of relief from import taxes amid growing US voter dissatisfaction over the cost of living.
title: Trump Deepens Tariff Cut on Brazilian Foods as Prices Mount

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said any proposal for a peace agreement with Russia must have the Ukraine’s consent, as European leaders seek to ensure that regional security concerns are addressed in US-led talks to end the war.
title: Starmer Says Any Peace With Russia Must Have Ukraine’s Consent

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: Silicon Valley-friendly Republicans and MAGA populists are at odds.
title: Trump’s Base Is Divided in the Battle Over Regulating AI

author: Matthew Malinowski
description: Chilean President Gabriel Boric’s recent criticism of Donald Trump was “disappointing” and shows how far bilateral relations “have fallen,” the newly arrived US ambassador said at his first press conference.
title: New US Ambassador Slams Chile’s President for Criticizing Trump

author: Magdalena Del Valle
description: Efforts at reducing child poverty worldwide are stalling amid a funding crisis for crucial programs, according to a United Nations report released on Thursday.
title: Child Poverty Efforts Stalling Amid Global Funding Cuts, UN Says

author: Patricia Hurtado, Maggie Eastland, Miles J. Herszenhorn
description: Federal prosecutors charged two Chinese nationals and two US citizens with a scheme to ship hundreds of sophisticated chips made by Nvidia Corp. to China in violation of national security export restrictions.
title: US Accuses Four of Smuggling Advanced Nvidia Chips to China

author: Zoe Tillman
description: A federal judge moved to block President Donald Trump’s deployment of National Guard troops in Washington, the latest setback to the president’s military mobilizations in Democrat-led cities.
title: Judge Moves to Block Trump Washington National Guard Deployment

author: Erik Wasson, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senator Lindsey Graham blocked an attempt to repeal a controversial provision tucked into the bill ending the US government shutdown that could reap him and several other Republican senators millions by allowing them to sue the Justice Department over telephone record seizures during the 2020 election interference probe.
title: Senator Graham Stops Repeal of Payout That May Reap Him Millions

author: Manuela Tobias, Jonathan Gilbert
description: Investors seeking to capitalize on Javier Milei’s next round of market reforms are gearing up to bid in a tender to privatize Argentina’s beleaguered freight railways, part of the president’s effort to unleash vast agriculture and mining exports.
title: Grupo Mexico, Major Crop Traders Eye Milei Rail Privatization in Argentina

author: Ellen Milligan
description: The UK has identified which military units it would send to Ukraine after a series of reconnaissance visits in the country, ensuring it would be ready to swiftly deploy troops if the latest effort to revive peace talks succeeds.
title: UK Steps Up Plan to Send Troops to Ukraine as US Revives Talks

author: Lydia Beyoud
description: Michael Selig’s nomination to lead the US Commodity Futures Trading Commission was advanced by the Senate Agriculture Committee on Thursday.
title: CFTC Chairman Nominee Selig Advanced by Senate Panel

author: Samy Adghirni
description: The military head of France’s armed forces sparked an uproar after saying the country must be prepared to see French soldiers die if it wants to deter potential future aggression from Russia.
title: General Says France Must Be Ready to See Sons Die to Deter Putin

author: Janice Kew
description: China will finance HIV-prevention programs in South Africa for the first time, taking a small step into the massive void left by US funding cuts earlier this year.
title: China Boosts South Africa HIV Drive, Huge US Funding Gaps Remain

author: Myles Miller
description: President Donald Trump quietly nominated Robert Cekada, the deputy director of the Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives, to serve as the agency’s chief, according to a notice sent to Congress this week.
title: Trump Picks ATF Veteran to Lead Agency Facing Major Overhaul

author: Andrea Palasciano, Ellen Milligan, Michael Nienaber
description: Germany is pressing the European Union to strike a last-minute deal to let the UK access the bloc’s massive defense fund before a deadline at the end of the month.
title: Germany Pushes to Let UK Join €150 Billion EU Defense Fund

author: Aliaksandr Kudrytski
description: Belarus’s leader released additional political prisoners and said he’ll seek a fresh round of talks with US officials in the latest signal that his Russian-aligned regime is making overtures to the West.
title: Belarus Seeks New US Talks as It Signals Softening Stance on EU

author: Augusta Saraiva
description: Brazil President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva nominated his government’s top lawyer, a prominent evangelical Christian, to join the Supreme Court in a nod to the fast-growing religious and political constituency.
title: Lula Taps Evangelical for Brazil’s Top Court Ahead of 2026 Vote

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he’s agreed to work on a peace plan drafted by the US and Russia and expects to talk with Donald Trump in the coming days about the proposals.
title: Zelenskiy Says He Agreed to Work on US Draft Plan to End War

author: Katy O'Donnell, Nancy Cook
description: The US’s top mortgage regulator has frustrated many of Trump’s top aides, but the president himself likes Pulte’s pit-bull approach.
title: Housing Chief Bill Pulte Becomes a Potential Liability for Donald Trump

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: President Donald Trump said a group of Democratic lawmakers should be put on trial — and suggested they should even face the death penalty — after they released a video telling government employees to refrain from following orders that broke the law.
title: Trump Calls for Sedition Trial After Democrats Warn Troops

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa received notice from the US about a “change of mind” in Washington’s participation in the Group of 20 summit this weekend, President Cyril Ramaphosa said.
title: South Africa Says US Changed Mind on G-20; White House Denies It

description: Boris Johnson and his top adviser presided over a "toxic and chaotic culture" in Downing Street that undermined efforts to deal with the pandemic, the Covid Inquiry has found.
title: Boris Johnson Oversaw ‘Toxic and Chaotic’ Downing Street, Covid Inquiry Finds

author: Sergio Mendoza
description: Bolivia’s new government expects to secure up to $5 billion in multilateral loans next year and return to international credit markets in late 2026 or early 2027, Finance Minister José Gabriel Espinoza said in an interview.
title: Bolivia Charts Return to International Credit Market by 2027

author: Emily Birnbaum, Oma Seddiq, Shirin Ghaffary
description: The Trump administration and tech lobbyists are aggressively pushing lawmakers to use must-pass defense legislation to block emerging state-level regulatory efforts that would hold companies accountable for harms caused by artificial intelligence products.
title: AI Czar Sacks Pushes to Use Year-End Bill to Stop State AI Laws

author: Jonathan Tirone
description: Iran officially ended all remaining cooperation with international nuclear inspectors after the United Nations atomic watchdog passed a resolution ordering Tehran to come clean about the status of its near-bomb-grade uranium stockpile.
title: Iran Pulls Plug on UN Nuclear Inspections After Western Rebuke

author: Daryna Krasnolutska
description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy is scrambling to resist a potentially humiliating peace deal put forward by US officials just as the Ukrainian president faces growing domestic pressure to ditch his most trusted aide in the war against Russia.
title: Zelenskiy Pressured to Accept Peace Plan US Drafted With Russia

author: Daniel Basteiro, Clara Hernanz Lizarraga
description: Spain’s chief prosecutor, Álvaro García Ortiz, has been barred from holding public office for two years for disclosing classified information, according to a statement by the Supreme Court.
title: Spanish Prosecutor Barred From Office for Leaks Aiding Sanchez

author: Nduka Orjinmo
description: A Nigerian court convicted separatist leader Nnamdi Kanu of terrorism, a ruling that risks reigniting regional tensions and worsening the nation’s already fragile security situation.
title: Nigerian Court Convicts Separatist Leader Kanu of Terrorism

author: Jessica Nix, Rachel Cohrs Zhang
description: The US Centers for Disease Control and Prevention updated a page on its website to suggest vaccines may cause autism, rejecting longstanding medical consensus on the topic and advancing a campaign from Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr.
title: CDC Updates Vaccines Site to Add Long-Debunked Link to Autism

author: Lucy White
description: Those earning over £125,000 ($163,000) would be allowed to apply to settle permanently in the UK after three years, according to new rules the Home Office will put forward later on Thursday.
title: UK to Allow High-Earners New, Faster Visa Path to Residency

author: Chandra Asmara, Harry Suhartono
description: Indonesia has barred Victor Hartono — the eldest son of billionaire Robert Budi Hartono — from leaving the country in connection with a tax-related corruption probe, according to a law ministry official.
title: Indonesia Bars Tycoon’s Son From Travel Amid Tax Probe

author: Jaya Saxena
description: Cannabis beverages with up to 100mg of THC are increasingly popular. A ban on hemp is threatening their survival.
title: Weed Drinks That Get You Very, Very High Could Be Gone Soon

author: Ignacio Olivera Doll
description: Despite a chorus of calls from investors, Argentine President Javier Milei and his advisers are hesitant to rapidly build reserves, let the peso float and relax currency controls.
title: Milei Defies Investor Calls to Build Up Argentina’s FX Reserves

author: Anthony Halpin
description: Armenia deal with Nvidia will bolster  US interests in the strategically vital Caucasus.
title: The Long Reach of Trump’s Nvidia AI Diplomacy

author: Nacha Cattan
description: The New York-area suburb of Summit is struggling to make progress on a mandate to add affordable homes.
title: A Wealthy New Jersey Town’s Empty Firehouse Shows Strain of Fixing Housing Crisis

author: James Mayger, Colum Murphy
description: From warning tourists to halting seafood imports, China has followed a well-worn playbook in punishing Japan for Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi’s remarks linking a Taiwan conflict to her country’s security. But one weapon remains conspicuously holstered: rare earths.
title: Xi Risks Global Blowback If China Cuts Off Rare Earths for Japan

author: Alessandra Migliaccio
description: For Premier Giorgia Meloni, a review by Moody’s Ratings this week is the chance to get the last big piece of the puzzle into place in her push to rehabilitate Italy.
title: Italy Is Poised for Moody’s Verdict After Seven Years on Brink of Junk

author: Andrea Palasciano, Arne Delfs
description: The European Union’s top diplomat Kaja Kallas said any attempt to bring peace to Ukraine must involve Kyiv, after a series of US-Russia proposals to end the war caught other western allies off guard.
title: EU Top Diplomat Says Any Peace Plan Needs to Involve Ukraine

author: Alexander Parker
description: African nations are starting to adjust to Donald Trump’s new world order and investors are taking notice.
title: African Businesses Plot Trump-Proof Path as Confidence Builds

author: Alastair Gale
description: The US has Japan’s back in its dispute with China over remarks made by Prime Minister Sanae Takaichi about Taiwan, US Ambassador to Japan George Glass said Thursday, adding that some of the reaction from Beijing has been “outrageous.”
title: The US Has Japan’s Back in Any Dispute with China, Glass Says

author: Pablo Mayo Cerqueiro, Leonard Kehnscherper, Jinshan Hong
description: Investment firepower for UK stocks has been depleted over years
title: London IPOs Are Dribbling Back But Funds Don’t Have Cash to Buy

author: Ruth Carson, Sheryl Tian Tong Lee
description: Countries such as UK that are running deficits and relying on financial markets to fund them are “definitely” at risk of another Liz Truss moment, said Mark Coombs, chief executive officer at asset manager Ashmore Group.
title: UK Not Alone in Risking Another ‘Liz Truss Moment,’ Ashmore Says

author: Andrea Dudik, Slav Okov, Misha Savic
description: The seizure of oil refineries in Bulgaria and potentially Serbia shows how Putin’s influence has waned in the region since he invaded Ukraine.
title: Trump’s Sanctions Undermine Putin’s Sway in the Balkans

author: Joumanna Bercetche, Dana Khraiche
description: Lebanon’s Prime Minister Nawaf Salam said his country is ready to engage with Israel and will seek US help in pushing for negotiations, as the Jewish state intensifies air strikes on Iran-backed Hezbollah.
title: Lebanon’s Premier to Seek US Help to Draw Israel Into Talks

author: Colum Murphy
description: China and the European Union have made little headway in repairing ties since a summer summit, the bloc’s top envoy to Beijing said, though the Asian nation’s easing of rare earth controls offered a chance for reset.
title: EU’s Top China Envoy Rues Uneasy Ties, Urges Reset With Beijing

author: Mackenzie Hawkins
description: White House officials are urging members of Congress to reject a measure that would limit Nvidia Corp.’s ability to sell AI chips to China and other adversary nations, according to people familiar with the matter, dimming prospects for legislation opposed by the world’s most valuable company.
title: White House Asks Congress to Reject Bill Curbing Nvidia Exports

author: Andreo Calonzo
description: The Philippines on Thursday auctioned off seven luxury vehicles linked to the corruption scandal that rocked the nation, as the government pushes to recover stolen public funds.
title: Philippines Auctions Off Rolls-Royce, Mercedes-Benz Cars Linked to Graft Scandal

author: Toru Fujioka
description: Bank of Japan board member Junko Koeda signaled that there could be a rate hike as soon as next month by pointing to the need for normalization, after the yen hit its lowest level in roughly 10 months.
title: BOJ Board Member Suggests Chance of December Hike After Yen Drop

author: Skylar Woodhouse
description: Donald Trump and New York City Mayor-elect Zohran Mamdani are set to meet at the White House on Friday, the president said in a social media post.
title: Trump to Host NYC Mayor-Elect Mamdani at White House on Friday

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: US President Donald Trump signed legislation to compel the Department of Justice to release files on the late, disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein.
title: Trump Signs Epstein Files Bill After Fight That Split GOP

author: Oma Seddiq
description: President Donald Trump is preparing to sign an executive order that would allow the Department of Justice to sue states over artificial intelligence regulations it deems unconstitutional, according to a draft making the rounds on K Street, Capitol Hill, and seen by Bloomberg Government.
title: State AI Laws to Be Challenged Under Forthcoming Trump Order
